name: Secure Contexts
summary: As the web enables more powerful apps, features which enable those apps should only be enabled in contexts which meet a specific security level. This also exposes the APIs that identify if you’re in a secure context.

name: Font Variation Properties with OpenType Variable Font Support
summary: Allows multiple instances of fonts to be defined by interpolating glyph outlines along different axis.

name: font-variant longhands
summary: Allows authors to utilize longhand properties of font-variant-caps, font-variant-ligatures, font-variant-numeric, font-variant-alternates, font-variant-east-asian, font-variant-position for font selection and adjustments rather than utilizing lower level props such as font-feature-settings.

name: SVG Accessibility API Mappings
summary: Defines how user agents map SVG markup to platform accessibility application programming interfaces.

name: Digital Publishing Accessibility API Mappings
summary: Defines how user agents map the Digital Publishing WAI-ARIA Module markup to platform accessibility APIs.

name: -webkit-text-stroke
summary: The -webkit-text-stroke property sets the stroke width and color of an element’s text.

name: WebVR
summary: Support for Virtual Reality applications on the web using head-mounted displays. The WebVR 1.1 API is fully supported in Microsoft Edge. Viewing WebVR content requires a Windows Mixed Reality headset, or the Windows Mixed Reality Portal Simulator (accessible via Developer Mode in the Windows 10 Creators Update).

name: requestIdleCallback
summary: Allows developers to cooperatively schedule background tasks to avoid introducing delays with high priority tasks in the same event loop.

name: Support CSS transforms on SVG
summary: Enable support for CSS transforms on elements and presentational attributes of SVG

name: CSS resize
summary: Allows one to specify whether or not an element is resizable by the user, and if so, along which axis/axes

name: CSS outline-offset
summary: Allows you to define an offset from the border box for your outline

name: Frame Timing
summary: An interface for web applications to access runtime performance information of the browser event loop.

name: Performance Observer
summary: An interface to observe the performance timeline (https://w3c.github.io/performance-timeline) and receive notifications of new performance entries as they are recorded.

name: CSS Containment
summary: A primitive for isolating style, layout, and paint. This will allow web developers to opt into the various aspects of the pipeline, allowing for UA optimizations.

name: Initial Letter
summary: Allows the author to set the size and depth at which it sinks into the surrounding text.

name: Intersection Observer
summary: An interface to allow a web developer to asynchronously query the position of an element with respect to other elements or the global viewport.

name: Resize Observer
summary: Allows a web developer to attach an observer to an element and a callback will be fired when that element is resized

name: Server Timing
summary: Enables the server to communicate request-response cycle metrics to the user agent, and provides a JavaScript interface to enable applications to access and act on those metrics.

name: Preload
summary: A keyword that may be used with "link" elements which provides a declarative fetch primitive that initiates an early fetch and separates fetching from resoruce execution.

name: DNS Prefetch Resource Hints
summary: A link relation type used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources and that the browser should resolve as early as possible.

name: Preconnect Resource Hints
summary: A link relation type used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources, so the browser can open a connection early for resouces that will be required later in the loading process.

name: High Resolution Time 2
summary: An API that provides translation of the current sub-millisecond resolution time between origins.

name: High Resolution Time 3
summary: Adds performance.timeOrigin, allowing DOMHighResTimeStamps from separate Windows to be interleaved into a single timeline.

name: Brotli Compressed Data Format
summary: Support for the Brotli data format as an HTTP content-encoding method.

name: <datalist> Element
summary: Shows a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user when entering an input element.

name: Credential Management API
summary: Credential Management API describes an imperative API enabling a website to request a user’s credentials from a user agent, and to help the user agent correctly store user credentials for future use.

name: Web Authentication API
summary: Web Authentication provides an open, scalable, and interoperable solution to facilitate authentication, which replaces passwords with stronger two-factor credentials.  The implementation in Microsoft Edge is focused on enabling Microsoft Passport with a PIN or Windows Hello to securely authenticate to Microsoft properties and third-party web sites.  As of EdgeHTML 14, the implementation is prefixed and based on the FIDO 2.0 Web APIs. Microsoft is a member of the FIDO Alliance.

name: FIDO U2F
summary: FIDO Universal Second Factor API allows online services to augment the security of their existing password infrastructure by adding a strong second factor to user login via a USB or NFC device. Also see FIDO 2.0 Web APIs, a newer specification that supports additional authentication methods, such as biometrics, and can replace passwords altogether as well as provide U2F functionality.

name: <details>/<summary>
summary: Interactive widget to show/hide content.

name: webkitdirectory and webkitRelativePath
summary: Support for the webkitdirectory attribute on the input tag to make it allow a directory be selected instead of files. Support for the webkitRelativePath property on the File interface to allow the identification of relative paths of files.

name: Directory Upload
summary: Enable directory uploading by allowing a developer to read directory contents (files and sub-directories) asynchronously and be able to identify the directory structure.
Enable a responsive images solution by providing the browser multiple resources in varying resolutions for a single image.

name: Extended srcset and sizes support
summary: Extends the current implementation of the srcset attribute by adding support for the width descriptor and the sizes attribute.

name: <picture> Element
summary: Enable a responsive images solution by declaring multiple resources for an image using CSS media queries.

name: <template> Element
summary: HTML template element to allow creating fragment of inert HTML as a prototype for stamping out DOM (often used in Web Components).

name: <meter> Element
summary: The HTML meter element allows representation of a scalar measurement of a known range, or fractional value, i.e. a gauge. Distinct from the progress element.

name: selectionDirection attribute on text input elements
summary: Returns the string corresponding to the current selection direction on text input elements: "forward", "backward", or "none".

name: oninvalid event handler
summary: Provides specified alert text if an input element is invalid.

name: Canvas 2D ellipse
summary: Provides a method to draw arcs on a 2D canvas drawing surface.

name: Canvas 2D Path2D
summary: Path2D objects can be used to declare paths that are then later used on CanvasRenderingContext2D objects.

name: CSS Range Pseudo-classes
summary: :in-range and :out-of-range pseudo-classes to match elements that are candidates for constraint validation, have range limitations, and are/are not suffering from underflow or overflow.

name: CSS Mutability Pseudo-classes
summary: :read-only and :read-write pseudo-classes to match elements which are considered user-alterable for the purposes of Selectors.

name: a[download] attribute
summary: When used on an <a>, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigating to it.

name: Application Cache
summary: Enables web pages to work without the user being connected to the internet

name: Audio tracks
summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple audio tracks, and switch between them using the AudioTrack.enabled attributes.

name: Video tracks
summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple video tracks, and switch between them using the VideoTrack.selected attributes.

name: Blob
summary: Allows you to construct Blobs directly (var blob = new Blob(["1234"], {type: 'text/plain'})). Blob() constructor also can take ArrayBufferView directly rather than constructing a blob with ArrayBuffer.

name: ES6 Block bindings (let, const, function)
summary: Allows developers to explicitly qualify access to variables within a block.

name: Canvas
summary: Provides an API to draw 2D graphics

name: Canvas focus ring
summary: Adds APIs to the canvas 2D context that make it possible to draw a focus ring around a canvas path and notify the operating system of the bounding box of the focused object for accessibility.

name: Compositing and Blending in Canvas 2D
summary: The canvas 2d context has the globalCompositeOperation attribute that is used to set the current compositing and blending operator.

name: Content Security Policy
summary: Allows you to create an allow list of sources of trusted content, and instructs the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

name: Content Security Policy Level 2
summary: An evolution of the Content Security Policy specification, allowing developers to create a whitelist of sources of trusted content, and instructing the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

name: CSP Level 3 strict-dynamic source expression
summary: Allows script loaded via a CSP2 nonce-based or hash-based whitelist to load other script, enabling developers and site administrators to reduce their reliance on whitelists and to tighten CSP implementations.

name: CSP upgrade-insecure-requests directive
summary: Allows a server to instruct the user agent to upgrade insecure requests via a Content-Security-Policy header. This directive is meant to make it even easier for a site administrator to move towards using all secure transports, while avoiding having to make massive updates to URLs in their web applications.

name: CSS calc()
summary: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. width: calc(100% - 3em)

name: CSS Device Adaptation
summary: The @viewport rule, in combination with media queries, enabled web developers to optimize the layout of sites and apps for different devices with minimal effort. It generalizes the viewport meta tag to CSS, while being much simpler to understand and without the quirks that exists with the meta tag.

name: CSS touch-action
summary: New CSS property to enable websites to declaratively state how touches should be handled for purposes of scrolling and zooming.

name: CSS Custom Properties (a.k.a. CSS Variables)
summary: Introduces cascading variables as a new primitive value type that is accepted by all CSS properties, and custom properties for defining them.

name: CSS Will Change
summary: Adds a will-change CSS property, that can be used to signal that a particular property is likely to be changed in the future, or that an element's content is likely to change.

name: CSSOM View smooth scroll API
summary: Adds an optional argument to existing scroll APIs that specifies whether scrolling should be smooth. Also adds a CSS property for this.

name: Custom Elements
summary: Method for registering (creating) custom elements in script (often used in Web Components).

name: Device Motion
summary: Provides access to device's physical motion.

name: Device Orientation
summary: Provides access to device's physical orientation

name: devicePixelRatio on zoom
summary: Update window.devicePixelRatio on full page zoom so that it accurately portrays the ratio between css and device pixels.

name: DOM3 Keyboard Events
summary: KeyboardEvent: keydown, keyup, keypress

name: DOM3 mouseenter & mouseleave Events
summary: DOM event analog of CSS :hover psuedo-selector that fires as the mouse enters and exits the bounding box of an element (including its children).

name: DOM3 Wheel Events
summary: Implementation of the standard DOM Level 3 WheelEvent for mouse wheel rotation.

name: Drag and Drop Directories
summary: Allows dragging and dropping entire folders using HTML5 Drag and Drop. Extends the DataTransferItem with a method to get a FileEntry/DirectoryEntry.

name: Encrypted Media Extensions
summary: Defines a common API that may be used to discover, select and interact with such systems as well as with simpler content encryption systems.

name: Exclusions
summary: Define areas inline content should avoid, and how inline content should wrap around them.

name: Filters
summary: Apply filter effects to arbitrary DOM elements.

name: Flexbox
summary: A CSS box model optimized for user interface design. The children of a flex container can be laid out in any direction and can "flex" their sizes to fill unused space and  avoid overflowing the parent.

name: Fullscreen API
summary: Programmatically instruct content on the page to be presented in the browser's full screen (kiosk) mode. Starting in 14.14393, this is prefixed in Edge due to compatibility issues. We are working with other browser vendors to coordinate switching to an unprefixed implementation in the future.

name: GamePad API
summary: Gives JS access to a game controller via USB.

name: Generated Content for Paged Media
summary: CSS properties helpful for printed publication.

name: Geolocation
summary: Provides access to device's physical location

name: Media Capture and Streams
summary: Provides access to the user's local audio and video input/output devices (getUserMedia API).

name: Gradients
summary: Gradients provide a method to, over a customizable amount of space, transition from one color to another.

name: CSS Grid Layout
summary: A two-dimensional grid-based layout system, optimized for user interface design.

name: HTML Form HTTP Extensions
summary: An addendum to HTML5 forms extending the abilities of configuring HTTP requests through HTML markup.

name: HTML Imports
summary: Import HTML documents into other HTML documents (often used in Web Components).

name: HTTP Client Hints
summary: Header for proactive content negotiation; just as the Accept header allowed clients to indicate what formats they prefer, Client Hints allow clients to indicate a list of device and agent specific preferences.

name: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
summary: Header to inform the browser to always request a given domain over SSL, reducing MITM attack surface area.

name: SPDY/3
summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content.

name: HTTP/2
summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content standardized by the IETF.

name: iframe[sandbox] attribute
summary: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (i.e. no JavaScript) in iframes (<iframe sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-forms" src="..."></iframe>)

name: iframe[seamless] attribute
summary: The seamless attribute is used to embed an <iframe> in the calling page without scrollbars or borders (e.g. seamlessly) and with the parent document's styles applying to the embedded seamless iframe.

name: iframe[srcdoc] attribute
summary: Gives the content of an iframe as a src context to embed (e.g. ).

name: IME API
summary: Provides Web applications with scripted access to an IME (input-method editor).

name: IndexedDB
summary: An asynchronous client-side storage API offering fast access to large amounts of structured data

name: IndexedDB Arrays and MultiEntry Support
summary: Extends the existing IndexedDB implementation with support for compound keys, indexed array values, and multiEntry.

name: WebGL Instancing Extension
summary: A way to use the GPU to quickly draw a lot of copies of a single object. In some scenes (like a forest with a lot of trees) it is a great way to get a huge performance improvement. Requires a compatible GPU.

name: Map (ES6)
summary: Map objects are simple key/value maps.

name: Masks
summary: Allows hiding of portions of a visible elements.

name: matchMedia
summary: API for testing if a given media query will apply.

name: MathML
summary: An application of XML for describing mathematical notations and capturing both its structure and content.

name: Media Queries: resolution feature
summary: Allows to query the device pixel count per CSS unit

name: Media Source Extensions
summary: Allows appending data to an <audio>/<video> element.

name: MediaRecorder
summary: Encode audio and video streams in the browser.

name: Microdata
summary: Microdata is used to nest semantics within existing content on web pages.

name: CSS Transforms - preserve-3d
summary: Augments existing CSS 3d transforms by facilitating the construction of complex 3d scenes.

name: mix-blend-mode
summary: Provides a way to blend an HTML or SVG element with its backdrop

name: background-blend-mode
summary: Specifies the blending mode used for each background layer

name: Cross-Domain Font Loading
summary: Increases interoperability with the web by relaxing domain and licensing metadata restrictions for EOT, WOFF, and TrueType fonts. Development work for IE is currently for Windows Phone only.

name: Multi-column (full support)
summary: Allows content to be flowed into multiple columns with a gap and a rule between them using CSS.

name: Mutation Observers
summary: Provides notifications when DOM nodes are rearranged or modified.

name: Navigation Timing API
summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to navigation and elements.

name: Page Visibility API
summary: Provides an API to ask whether the current tab is visible or not. If so, you might want to throttle back action or set an idle state.

name: Pointer Events
summary: Unified pointer input API (e.g. mouse, pen, touch input) which addresses several existing problems (especially on touchscreen laptops) and provides future extensibility.

name: Pointer Lock (Mouse Lock)
summary: Gives access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits of how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view. Obvious use cases are for first person or real time strategy games.

name: position: sticky
summary: position: sticky is a new way to position elements and is conceptually similar to position: fixed. The difference is that a stickily positioned element behaves like position: relative within its parent, until a given offset threshold is met.

name: postMessage
summary: Safely enables cross-origin communication.

name: Quota Management API
summary: This API can be used to check how much quota an app/origin is using.

name: Regions
summary: Magazine-like content flow into specified regions.

name: requestAnimationFrame()
summary: Offload animation repainting to browser for optimized performance. You should call this method whenever you're ready to update your animation onscreen. This will request that your animation function be called before the browser performs the next repaint.

name: Resource Timing API
summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to HTML elements.

name: Service Worker
summary: ServiceWorkers (formerly Navigation Controllers) are a new system that provides event-driven scripts that run independent of web pages. They are similar to SharedWorkers except that their lifetime is different and they have access to domain-wide events such as network fetches.

name: Set (ES6)
summary: Set objects let you store unique values of any type, whether primitive values or object references.

name: Streams API: ReadableStream
summary: A readable stream represents a source of data, from which you can read.

name: Streams API: WritableStream
summary: A writable stream represents a destination for data, into which you can write.

name: Subpixel font scaling
summary: Allow sub-css-pixel font-sizes and thus smooth font scaling.

name: SVG2
summary: Implement the new SVG2 features.

name: Support dataset property on SVGElement
summary: The dataset IDL attribute provides access to custom data attributes on SVG elements. Its behavior is the same as the corresponding IDL member on the HTMLElement interface.

name: TLS 1.2
summary: The latest version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Allows for data/message confidentiality, and message authentication codes for message integrity and as a by-product message authentication.

name: TLS 1.3
summary: Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol version 1.3 allows faster and more secure connection compared to TLS 1.2 by reducing round trip number, and removing legacy vulnerable cryptography features.

name: Track element
summary: Add subtitles, captions, screen reader descriptions, chapters and other types of timed metadata to video and audio.

name: Transforms
summary: Enables changing the position of content in 3D space without disrupting the normal flow. See also preserve-3d.

name: Typed Arrays (ES6)
summary: Buffers for holding binary data and working with WebGL & Audio API: ArrayBuffer, Float32Array , Int16Array, Uint8Array, etc.)

name: UIEvents - Keyboard Query APIs
summary: Identify the physical key being pressed; Query key from layout.

name: URL API
summary: Expose constructible URL objects that can be manipulated and combined.

name: URLSearchParams
summary: Allows developers to manipulate the search params of a URL.

name: User Timing API
summary: Helps web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.

name: Vibration API
summary: This specification defines an API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device. Vibration is a form of tactile feedback.

name: WeakMap (ES6)
summary: WeakMaps are key/value maps in which keys are objects.

name: Web Animations JavaScript API
summary: A unified model for supporting animation and synchronization on the Web platform.

name: Web Crypto API
summary: JavaScript bindings for cryptographic operations. Note: we are looking to update our current implementation to the latest W3C Last Call Working Draft specification.

name: Web MIDI API
summary: Defines an API supporting the MIDI protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.

name: Web Notifications
summary: An API for displaying simple notifications to the user.

name: Web Speech API (Speech Recognition)
summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech recognition into their web pages.

name: Web Speech API (synthesis)
summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech synthesis into their web pages.

name: Web SQL Database
summary: API exposing an SQLite database

name: Web Storage
summary: Refers to both localStorage and sessionStorage

name: WebGL  (Canvas 3D)
summary: 3D rendering via the <canvas> element.

name: WebGL 2.0
summary: An update to WebGL, based on OpenGL ES 3.0

name: APNG image format
summary: APNG is an extension of the PNG format, adding support for animated images.

name: WebP image format
summary: WebP is an image format that provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.

name: WebRTC – WebRTC v1.0 API
summary: Real-time communication in the browser. See also "Web RTC - Object RTC API". At this time, RTC features are supported only on desktop platform.

name: WebRTC – Object RTC API
summary: Enables mobile endpoints to talk to servers and web browsers with Real-Time Communications (ORTC) capabilities via native and simple JavaScript APIs. At this time, RTC features are supported only on desktop platform.

name: WebSocket
summary: The WebSockets JavaScript API provides a simple API for bi-directional communication with web servers. The WebSocket network protocol enables low overhead bi-directional communication with web servers over a persistent TCP connection.

name: XMLHttpRequest timeout
summary: Exposing the XHR timeout property and sending corresponding events such as ontimeout.

name: XMLHttpRequest.responseURL attribute
summary: Returns the serialized URL of the response (with the exclude fragment flag set) or returns the empty string if the URL is null.

name: Arrow function (ES6)
summary: The arrow (=>) provides a shorthand for the function keyword with lexical 'this' binding.

name: Box Alignment
summary: CSS properties for aligning boxes within their container. Allows for true vertical centering among other features.

name: CSS filter() image function
summary: The function allows filtering an CSS input image with a set of filter functions. The used filter functions are the same as for the CSS filter property. The filter() function can be animated as well.

name: CSS filter(url) using SVG elements
summary: The function allows filtering using SVG Filter elements as the filter function.

name: Default parameter (ES6)
summary: Allows formal parameters to be initialized with default values if no value is passed.

name: Destructuring (ES6)
summary: Destructuring assignment allows extracting data from arrays or objects using a syntax that mirrors array and object literals.

name: Rest parameters (ES6)
summary: Allows representation of an indefinite number of arguments as an array.

name: Ambient Light Sensor API
summary: Ambient Light Event API which is a handy way to make a web page or web app aware of any change in light intensity.

name: Battery Status API
summary: Allows access to see the battery level of the device's battery

name: Push API
summary: Provides webapps with scripted access to server-sent notifications.

name: Subresource Integrity
summary: Subresource Integrity defines a mechanism by which user agents may verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation. In a nutshell, metadata inlined into HTML elements allows the browser to determine whether the resource that was downloaded matches the resource the page's author expected to download.

name: CSS Intrinsic Sizing
summary: Extends the CSS sizing properties with keywords that represent content-based "intrinsic" sizes and context-based "extrinsic" sizes, allowing CSS to more easily describe boxes that fit their content or fit into a particular layout context.

name: CSS font-stretch
summary: Add support for the CSS font-stretch property.

name: Canvas2D text decoration
summary: Add a textDecoration attribute to canvas 2D contexts, behavior similar to existing "font" attribute: It's a DOMString, parsed the same way as corresponding CSS property (text-decoration).

name: ES6 Iterators (i.e. the for-of feature)
summary: Iterates over iterable objects (including arrays, array-like objects, iterators and generators), invoking a custom iteration hook with statements to be executed for the value of each distinct property.

name: Network Error Logging
summary: This specification defines an interface to store and retrieve error data related to the previous navigations of a document.

name: Shapes
summary: Define arbitrary shapes inside and around which inline content can flow.

name: Symbols (ES6)
summary: Allows properties to be added to existing objects without the possibility of interference with the existing properties, unintended visibility, or with other uncoordinated additions by any other code.

name: WebGL Shared Resources
summary: Allow sharing resources between 2 or more WebGL contexts

name: inputmode
summary: The inputmode content attribute is an enumerated attribute that specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content into the form control.

name: Object.observe()
summary: Observe changes to JS objects.

name: Shadow DOM
summary: Enables DOM tree encapsulation. Without it, widgets may inadvertently break pages by using conflicting CSS selectors, class or id names, or JavaScript variables (often used in Web Components).

name: Web Audio API
summary: A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications

name: object-fit and object-position (images)
summary: CSS properties that control the position and size of replaced content within the content box

name: object-fit and object-position (video/canvas/etc)
summary: CSS properties that control the position and size of replaced content within the content box

name: Conditional Rules
summary: Support for the @supports at-rule and the "window.CSS.supports()" API

name: Generators (ES6)
summary: A generator is a special type of function that works as a factory for iterators.

name: Custom filters (shaders)
summary: Filter effects are a way of processing an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document.

name: High Resolution Time
summary: Enables reliable, high-resolution timing of client-side performance.

name: Scoped Styles
summary: Boolean attribute for the <style> element (<style scoped>). When present, its styles only apply to the parent element.

name: Proxies (ES6)
summary: Proxies are objects for which the programmer has to define the semantics in JavaScript.

name: Touch Events
summary: Touchscreen input API, originally introduced by Apple on iOS. Support is currently limited to only devices with a touchscreen (can be overridden in about:flags). See Pointer Events for touch, pen, and mouse input across all device types.

name: onerror Exception Parameter (5th Parameter)
summary: Unhandled exceptions trigger the 'window.onerror' callback (or 'self.onerror' inside Workers) for centralized handling. The 5th parameter will have the exception itself.

name: FileWriter
summary: Enables writing to files from web applications.

name: FileReader
summary: The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read.

name: Server-Sent Events (EventSource)
summary: Enables push notifications from the server received as DOM events.

name: Message Channels
summary: A messaging system that allows documents to communicate with each other regardless of their source domain, in a way designed to avoid cross-site scripting attacks.

name: Efficient Script Yielding - setImmediate()
summary: Allows web applications to flush the browser event queue and receive an immediate callback.

name: Beacon
summary: Enables web applications to asynchronously transfer data from the user agent to a web server, with the user agent taking the responsibility to eventually send the data.

name: Prefetch Resource Hints
summary: Indicates the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the specified resource.

name: Prerender Resource Hints
summary: Provides a hint to the browser that another page is likely to be loaded by the user (such as the first result of a search) such that it may be prerendered for better performance.

name: CSS Scroll Snap Points
summary: Enables rich, customizable, and performant scrolling experiences like pagination of carousels by using snap points that enforce the scroll offsets that a scroll container may end at after a scrolling operation has completed.

name: DOM Level 3 XPath
summary: Provides simple functionality to access a DOM tree using the XPath syntax.

name: Screen Orientation API
summary: Provides the ability to read the screen orientation state, to be informed when this state changes, and to be able to lock the screen orientation to a specific state.

name: CSS pointer-events
summary: Enables control of whether an element can receive input events from a pointing device using an API similar to the existing pointer-events property from SVG.

name: WebDriver
summary: A platform and language-neutral interface and associated wire protocol that allows programs or scripts to introspect into, and control the behaviour of, a web browser.

name: SVG foreignobject element
summary: Allows for inclusion of a foreign namespace (such as HTML) which has its graphical content drawn by a different user agent

name: Media Queries Level 4: pointer and hover
summary: Allows to query the presence and accuracy of the user's pointing input (e.g. for differentiating touch versus mouse). Additionally, allows the page to query whether the user's pointing input supports hover.

name: Selection API
summary: Based on APIs from HTML5 and DOM Range, this specification includes additional methods for programmatically inspecting and modifying the selection.

name: ES6 Object Literal Enhancements
summary: Adds computed properties, concise method definitions, and short-hand for properties whose value is initialized to a same-named variable.

name: Promises (ES6)
summary: Allows easier and cleaner asynchronous coding. Adds the Promise constructor, along with the 'all' and 'race' utility methods to the language itself.

name: Shared Memory and Atomics
summary: Shared memory and atomics for ECMAscript.

name: Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors
summary: ECMAScript proposal for Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors.

name: Karaoke Web Standard
summary: Provides semantic language processing for two-way communication with a remote host. This new interface creates a system-to-system forced sonic recognition on the receiving party.

name: SVG External Content
summary: Allows referencing external content in SVG. A common use case for this would be <use xlink:href="lib.svg#template" fill="#000000"></use>

name: Meta Referrer
summary: Using the referrer metadata attribute, a document can control the behavior of the Referer HTTP header attached to requests that originate from the document.

name: dppx Unit for the resolution Media Query
summary: One dppx unit represents the number of 'dots' in a CSS px.

name: WAV Audio Support
summary: Enables PCM WAV audio support in HTML5 Audio.

name: DOM Event Constructors
summary: Replaces document.createEvent() and associated event object init methods with constructors for each event interface.

name: Math Built-ins (ES6)
summary: Math related functions - sign, trunc, sinh, cosh, tanh, asinh, acosh, atanh, log10, log2, hypot, fround, clz32, cbrt, log1p, expm1.

name: Number Built-ins (ES6)
summary: New methods and properties on Number, including isFinite, isInteger, isSafeInteger, isNaN, EPSILON, MIN_SAFE_INTEGER, and MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

name: String Built-ins (ES6)
summary: New methods on String including String.raw and String.fromCodePoint. New methods on String.prototype including codePointAt, normalize, repeat, startsWith, endsWith, and includes.

name: Object Built-ins (ES6)
summary: New methods on Object including assign, is, getOwnPropertySymbols, and setPrototypeOf

name: RegExp Built-ins (ES6)
summary: New methods on RegExp.prototype including match, replace, search, and split.

name: WeakSet (ES6)
summary: Contains a set of objects such that those objects will be collected if they are not referenced anywhere else.

name: __proto__ (ES6)
summary: Support for legacy prototype manipulation similar to Object.setPrototypeOf.

name: Classes (ES6)
summary: Syntax for declaring classes.

name: Spread (ES6)
summary: The spread operator expands iterable expressions into individual arguments. For example, a.b(…array) is roughly the same as a.b.apply(a, array).

name: Template Strings (ES6)
summary: String literals that allow for expressions to be evaluated and concatenated with the string literal.

name: Tail Calls (ES6)
summary: Enables boundlessly recursive algorithms (using constant stack space) for certain code patterns.

name: Subclassing (ES6)
summary: Allows subclassing of built-in types such as Dates and Arrays.

name: SIMD
summary: Enables Single Instruction, Multiple Data instructions to be used from Javascript programs.

name: Modules (ES6)
summary: Language-level support for defining and consuming modules.

name: ASM.js
summary: Performance options for a low-level subset of JavaScript, including recognition of the 'use asm' directive and ahead-of-time compilation.

name: Clipboard API
summary: Standard APIs for interacting with the clipboard (copy/cut/paste operations). IE currently supports a legacy model for clipboard access.

name: Web Application Manifest
summary: This specification defines a JSON-based manifest, which provides developers with a centralized place to put metadata associated with a web application.

name: Public Key Pinning Extension for HTTP
summary: Certificate public key pinning is a mechanism which allows specifying a key that must be present in the certificate chain associated with a domain name. HTTP Public Key Pinning (HPKP) is one way of doing certificate public key pinning. In this method, site owner defines pin rules for his domain name via HTTP header. This mechanism assumes that user has had a first clean connection to the site.

name: ECMAScript Internationalization API
summary: Provides APIs for string comparison and date/time/number formatting in a locale-aware manner.

name: ES6 Numeric Literals
summary: Allows binary and octal numeric literals using 0b101 and 0o753 respectively.

name: <dialog> element for modals
summary: An HTML element for modal and non-modal dialog boxes

name: Color input type
summary: Input controls for picking colors via <input type='color'>.

name: Date-related input types
summary: Input controls for picking dates via <input type='date'>,<input type='month'>, and <input type='week'>.

name: Time-related input types
summary: Input controls for picking times via <input type='time'>, and <input type='datetime-local'>.

name: <main> element
summary: Semantic HTML5 element that represents the main content of the document or application.

name: <keygen> element
summary: A form element for a key pair generator control.  Support here indicates UI for picking keys and some transport to submit them. However, significant interoperability issues exist with the DOM interfaces and protocols for this feature.

name: Media Fragments
summary: Standardizes a URL fragment syntax for specifying a fragment of a media resource.

name: SVG+SMIL Animation
summary: XML-based syntax for specifying animations of SVG.

name: Hardware Concurrency
summary: An API for reading the system's total number of logical processors available to the user agent, up to an optional thread limit per origin.

name: Web Bluetooth
summary: An API for communicating with Bluetooth Low Energy devices as a GATT Client.

name: Web NFC API
summary: Enables NFC (near field communications) wireless communication between two devices at close proximity, usually less than a few centimeters

name: Shared Web Workers
summary: A special type of WebWorker that can commincate across windows/tabs for a site.

name: Platform for Privacy Preferences 1.0 (P3P 1.0)
summary: The Platform for Privacy Preferences Project (P3P) enables web sites to express their privacy practices in a standard format allowing user agents to automate decision-making based on these practices when appropriate.

name: WOFF File Format 2.0
summary: Based on experience with WOFF 1.0, which is widely deployed, this specification was developed to provide improved compression and thus lower use of network bandwidth, while still allowing fast decompression even on mobile devices. This is achieved by combining a content-aware preprocessing step and improved entropy coding, compared to the Flate compression used in WOFF 1.0.

name: Fetch API
summary: The Fetch specification defines requests, responses, and the process that binds them; fetching.

name: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
summary: Expands our plugin-free adaptive video streaming to support the popular HLS protocol for transferring unbounded streams of multimedia data.

name: Motion JPEG (MJPG)
summary: Adds support for the MJPG video format, popular with IP cameras.

name: CSS Gradient Midpoints
summary: Allows specifying an optional location between the color stops of a CSS gradient.

name: ARIA Landmark Roles
summary: Support for ARIA roles indicating regions of the page intended as navigational landmarks.

name: HTML Sections in Accessibility API
summary: Exposes HTML sectioning elements (such as section, article, main, etc.) in the Accessibility API.

name: Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) 1.1
summary: Full support for new WAI-ARIA 1.1 roles, states, and properties which define new accessible user interface elements since WAI-ARIA 1.0. Microsoft Edge currently supports the following ARIA roles: none, article, definition, log, math, note, scrollbar,  application, banner, complementary, contentinfo, form, main, navigation, search; and ARIA properties: aria-atomic, aria-autocomplete, aria-dropeffect, aria-grabbed, aria-label, aria-multiline, aria-orientation, aria-sort, aria-valuetext. Note that WAI-ARIA support is complex and not fully implemented in any browser.

name: Accessible Name and Description: Computation and API Mappings 1.1
summary: Determines names and descriptions of accessible objects to expose via UIA for assistive technologies to describe to users.

name: CSS Transitions for SVG elements
summary: Allows CSS Transitions for SVG elements.

name: Upgrade insecure resource requests
summary: A mechanism which allows authors to instruct a user agent to upgrade a priori insecure resource requests to secure transport before Fetching them.

name: CSS Logical Properties Level 1
summary: Introduces logical properties and values that provide the author with the ability to control layout through logical, rather than physical, direction and dimension mappings.

name: Console Logging APIs
summary: APIs to log messages to a connected developer tool. Covering console.assert, console.log, console.info, console.warn, console.error, console.debug, console.dir, console.dirxml.

name: console.table
summary: console.table allows the logging of tabular data to a connected developer tool.

name: CSS initial value
summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the initial keyword, the property’s initial value becomes its specified value.

name: CSS unset value
summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the ‘‘unset’#’ keyword, then if it is an inherited property, this is treated as ‘inherit’, and if it is not, this is treated as ‘initial’. This keyword effectively erases all declared values occurring earlier in the cascade, correctly inheriting or not as appropriate for the property (or all longhands of a shorthand).

name: showModalDialog
summary: The global showModalDialog() method displays a modal dialog box containing a specified HTML document. This feature has an incredibly high cost in terms of code complexity since it requires us to run an event loop on top of an arbitrary JavaScript stack. It also complicates the web platform by making task dispatch reentrant and hard to reason about.

name: Backdrop filter
summary: Applies a CSS filter effect to the content behind an element. This is not the element's background but the content that would be drawn behind it.

name: International input[type=email] validation
summary: Adding support for international email addresses that use UTF-8 characters (e.g. 伊昭傑@郵件.商務, राम@मोहन.ईन्फो)

name: WebM Container
summary: An open media container format. Supported for adaptive streaming video on devices with VP9 hardware acceleration, may be enabled on any device via an about:flags setting.

name: Opus Audio Playback
summary: An open codec for audio playback.

name: Vorbis Audio Codec
summary: An open codec for audio.

name: Theora Video Codec
summary: An open video codec.

name: FLAC Audio Codec
summary: An open codec for audio.

name: OGG Container
summary: An open multimedia container.

name: VP9 Video Playback
summary: An open codec for video optimized on the web. In the current release, VP9 is only automatically enabled when hardware acceleration is detected. VP9 support can be toggled manually via about:flags.

name: VP8 for RTC
summary: Support for the VP8 video format in RTC scenarios.

name: H.264/AVC for RTC
summary: Support for H.264/AVC in RTC scenarios.

name: RTC Data Channels
summary: Data channels allow a web application to send and receive generic application data peer-to-peer.

name: image-rendering
summary: Provides a hint to the browser on which scaling algorithm should be used.

name: Conic Gradients
summary: Specifies a gradient where the color stops are placed around the circumference of a circle.

name: CSS Motion Path
summary: Motion paths allow authors to animate any graphical object along an author specified path.

name: CSS image-set()
summary: Enables responsive images in CSS by specifiying multiple resolutions of an image that the browser can select from for the given situation.

name: CSS all shorthand
summary: The all property is a shorthand that resets all CSS properties except direction and unicode-bidi

name: CSS vmax unit
summary: A viewport relative length unit equal to the larger of vw (viewport width) or vh (viewport height).

name: CSS Contextual Reference Element Pseudo-class :scope
summary: The :scope pseudo-class represents any element that is in the contextual reference element set.

name: CSS tab-size property
summary: The tab-size property sets the size used to render tab characters in situations where white space is preserved

name: CSS Relational Pseudo-class :has
summary: The relational pseudo-class, :has(), is a functional pseudo-class taking a relative selector list as an argument. Similar to jQuery’s :has() selector.

name: CSS Level 3 attr() function
summary: Support the attr() function as a component value in properties applied to an element. Currently, attr() is only supported in the content property applied to pseudo-elements.

name: <menu> Element
summary: An HTML element for toolbars and popup menus.

name: <time> Element
summary: An HTML element for representing dates and times.

name: <data> Element
summary: An HTML element which represents its content in machine-readable and human-readable formats.

name: <output> Element
summary: An HTML element for representing the result of a calculation or user action.

name: ol[reversed] attribute
summary: A boolean attribute that reverses the order of an ordered list when present.

name: Screen Capture
summary: Screen Capture API allows a user's display or parts thereof be used as the source of a media stream.

name: Media Capture from Canvas
summary: Media Capture API can be used to capture Canvas content as MediaStream to be recorded or transmitted to remote peers.

name: Media Capture from HTML Media Element
summary: Media Capture API can be used to capture non-DRM content from mediaelement into another MediaStream.

name: Audio Output Devices API
summary: The Audio Output Devices API allows a Web application to direct audio output to authorized endpoints other than the user agent default.

name: Form attribute
summary: Attribute for associating input and submit buttons with a form.

name: Reflect (ES6)
summary: Provides methods for use in operations that are intercepted. Reflect methods are often used with proxies because they allow you to delegate to default behavior without implementing the default behavior in your code.

name: FindText API
summary: Provides an API for finding ranges of text in a document, with a variety of selection criteria. Similar to a user-agent's find-on-page or page-search capability.

name: Payment Request API
summary: A web API to allow merchants (i.e. web sites selling physical or digital goods) to easily accept payments from different payment methods with minimal integration.

name: Web Assembly (MVP)
summary: WebAssembly or wasm is a new portable, size- and load-time-efficient format suitable for compilation to the web.

name: CSS Font Loading API
summary: This CSS module describes events and interfaces used for dynamically loading font resources.

name: Cache API
summary: The Cache API consists of additional ServiceWorker APIs which allow authors to fully and conveniently manage their content caches for offline use. An origin can have multiple, named Cache objects, whose contents are entirely under the control of Service Worker scripts.

name: Touch-action: pan-up pan-down pan-left pan-right CSS properties
summary: Adds additional direction-specific values for the CSS touch-action property for pan-up, pan-down, pan-left, pan-right have been added to the specification.

name: HTTP/2 Server Push
summary: HTTP/2 allows a server to pre-emptively send (or "push") responses (along with corresponding "promised" requests) to a client in association with a previous client-initiated request.  This can be useful when the server knows the client will need to have those responses available in order to fully process the response to the original request.

name: Encoding Standard
summary: This specification addresses gaps so user agents do not have to reverse engineer encoding implementations.

name: Geometry Interfaces
summary: This specification provides basic geometric interfaces to represent points, rectangles, quadrilaterals and transformation matrices that can be used by other modules or specifications.

name: Background Sync API
summary: Provides an API for notifying a Service Worker that the user has come back online, or to schedule periodic events to synchronize local data with the server.

name: Event Listener "once" Option
summary: Option to mark an event listener to fire only once

name: DOM ParentNode methods: prepend, append, and ChildNode methods: before, after, and replaceWith
summary: Convenience methods for working with DOM Node trees

name: Media Session
summary: Enable websites to customize media metadata so they can control the notification and lock screen UI. Also, allow them to control media in the page from outside the page, such as platform UIs and media keys.

name: Passive Event Listeners
summary: Provides an API to mark event listeners as "passive", primarily to allow for scrolling performance improvements

name: Cache-Control: Immutable
summary: Allows servers to identify resources that will not be updated during their freshness lifetime, thus, ensuring that a client never needs to revalidate a cached fresh resource to be certain it has not been modified.

name: CSS Selectors Level 4
summary: Extends the selectors with :matches, :has, :not(complex selector), :dir, case insensitive attribute matching and more.
